timeline.bodyText: Could you add it at the top with the other BOMs? We have separated them.
timeline.author: gsmet

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  - dependency-name: micrometer-io:micrometer-core
          
          
            
                  - dependency-name: micrometer-io:micrometer-bom
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -118,6 +118,8 @@ updates:
       - dependency-name: com.amazonaws:aws-lambda-java-events
       # Apache Commons
       - dependency-name: commons-io:commons-io
+      # Micrometer
+      - dependency-name: micrometer-io:micrometer-core

timeline.bodyText: And you will need to add micrometer-registry-stackdriver too as it's also using the property.
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -118,6 +118,8 @@ updates:
       - dependency-name: com.amazonaws:aws-lambda-java-events
       # Apache Commons
       - dependency-name: commons-io:commons-io
+      # Micrometer
+      - dependency-name: micrometer-io:micrometer-core
     rebase-strategy: disabled

timeline.message:
Update micrometer to 1.5.5

Co-authored-by: Guillaume Smet <guillaume.smet@gmail.com>

timeline.message:
Update micrometer to 1.5.5

Co-authored-by: Guillaume Smet <guillaume.smet@gmail.com>

Update micrometer to 1.5.5

Co-authored-by: Guillaume Smet <guillaume.smet@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Why add the io.micrometer:micrometer-registry-stackdriver dependency here? Isn't already in the micrometer-bom?
timeline.author: gastaldi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -118,6 +118,9 @@ updates:
       - dependency-name: com.amazonaws:aws-lambda-java-events
       # Apache Commons
       - dependency-name: commons-io:commons-io
+      # Micrometer
+      - dependency-name: io.micrometer:micrometer-bom
+      - dependency-name: io.micrometer:micrometer-registry-stackdriver

replies.bodyText: As explained to me by Guillaume, because we include stackdriver specifically in the application bom (we have to because we need to exclude transitive dependencies), we need to include it here, too.
replies.author: ebullient
